result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A. Letson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places
Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

supervisions.notes: AMENDED JOC -  COUNTS 3 & 4 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER AND Consecutive to 08CF126.  NO SENTENCE CREDIT GIVEN.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $250 and court costs including all applicable surcharges each count.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Perform  100    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by phone;  Attorney Brenda VanCuick appeared in person on behalf of the defendant.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:55am-  Attorney VanCuick does not object to the response from the State.  Court orders JOC be amended to reflect no sentence credit.  In addition, JOC is to specifically state that counts 3 & 4 are concurrent to each other.
Attorney VanCuick is requesting 5/12/2015 Hearing be rescheduled as she is not available.  Hearing is rescheduled to 5/11/2015 at 10:30am.  Parties notified via email.

Hearing on May 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
This hearing is scheduled to address the letter from Jodi Spencer, Institution Registrar for the Department of Corrections, dated February 17, 2015.  Defendant to appear by phone.

from ADA Jason Zapf agreeing w/ the analysis by the DOC
from Institution Registrar Jodi Spencer regarding sentence credit. Copy sent to DA for response; internal review set.

Defendant Justin A. Letson appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  
Ct 3: ITC is: 1 year, forthwith
ES  is: 1 year
TLS is: 2 year

Ct 4: ITC is: 15 months, forthwith
ES  is: 15 months
TLS is: 30 months

Counts run concurrent to each other and consecutive to 08CF126. 163 days sentence credit given. 100 hours of community service ordered. Conditions of extended supervision given. $250 fine on each count plus court costs ordered. No restitution requested. Defendant is eligible for the CIP and SAP programs. Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge. Appeal rights given.
